abstract: John V. Sperling, the son of the founder of the University of Phoenix, went on a buying spree of high-end San Francisco real estate earlier this decade, but unloading those properties is proving tricky, The Bay Citizen writes.
snippet: John V. Sperling, the son of the founder of the University of Phoenix, went on a buying spree of high-end San Francisco real estate earlier this decade, but unloading those properties is proving tricky, The Bay Citizen writes.
lead_paragraph: Being involved in big-ticket San Francisco real estate is not for the faint of heart. Imagine, then, the steely nerves of John V. Sperling.

headline.main: In San Francisco, Shopping 3 Big-Ticket Properties
